title: Unraveling Structural Characteristics of Honeycomb Amyloid Self-Assembling Peptide: HONEY ASAP!
content: Self-assembling peptides have shown great potential as biomaterials in regenerative medicine [1] due to their ability to form peptide nanofibers that mimic extracellular matrix elements. Such fibers can be engineered for therapeutic purposes by modifying the peptide sequence, which can tune cell adhesion and regeneration [2]. However, the relationship between peptide fibers and structural properties is not fully understood as there is lack of structural investigation of such fibrils. Contrarily, there is a large understanding of the assembly mechanism and final structure of amyloid forming peptides such as Amyloid-Î² 42.
